com.github.dm.jrt.channel

Class Channels

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channels

  • public class Channels
extends Object
    Utility class for handling routine channels.
    The class provides several methods to split and merge channels together, making also possible to transfer data in multiple streams, each one identified by a specific ID.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 03/15/2015.

      static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> replay(Channel<?,OUT> channel)
      Returns a builder of channels repeating the output data to any newly bound channel or consumer, thus effectively supporting multiple bindings.

    • Method Detail

      • blend

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> blend(@NotNull
                                                         Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [B, A, A, C, B, C, B, A, B, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • blend

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> blend(@NotNull
                                                         Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [B, A, A, C, B, C, B, A, B, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<Flow<? extends IN>,?> combine(@NotNull
                                                                         Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels combining the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the position in the array.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(0, IN).data, Flow(0, IN).data, Flow(0, IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(1, IN).data, Flow(1, IN).data, Flow(1, IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(2, IN).data, Flow(2, IN).data, Flow(2, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<Flow<? extends IN>,?> combine(int startId,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels combining the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will start from the specified one.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        startId - the flow start ID.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         Iterable<? extends Channel<? extends IN,?>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels combining the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will start from the specified one.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        startId - the flow start ID.
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<Flow<? extends IN>,?> combine(@NotNull
                                                                         Iterable<? extends Channel<? extends IN,?>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels combining the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the position in the iterable.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(0, IN).data, Flow(0, IN).data, Flow(0, IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(1, IN).data, Flow(1, IN).data, Flow(1, IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(2, IN).data, Flow(2, IN).data, Flow(2, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<Flow<? extends IN>,?> combine(@NotNull
                                                                         Map<Integer,? extends Channel<? extends IN,?>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels combining the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the keys of the specified map.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(key(A), IN).data, Flow(key(A), IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(key(B), IN).data, Flow(key(B), IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(key(C), IN).data, Flow(key(C), IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the map of IDs and channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified map is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified map is null or contains a null object.

      • concat

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> concat(@NotNull
                                                          Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels concatenating the outputs coming from the specified ones, so that, all the outputs of the first channel will come before all the outputs of the second one, and so on.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [A, A, A, ..., B, B, B, ..., C, C, C, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • concat

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> concat(@NotNull
                                                          Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels concatenating the outputs coming from the specified ones, so that, all the outputs of the first channel will come before all the outputs of the second one, and so on.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [A, A, A, ..., B, B, B, ..., C, C, C, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<List<? extends IN>,?> distribute(@NotNull
                                                                            Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified ones. If the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
 B => [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1)]
 C => [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2)]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<List<? extends IN>,?> distribute(@Nullable
                                                                            IN placeholder,
                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                            Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified ones. If the list of data is smaller than the specified number of channels, the remaining ones will be fed with the specified placeholder instance. While, if the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
 B => [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1), placeholder, ...]
 C => [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2), placeholder, placeholder, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<List<? extends IN>,?> distribute(@Nullable
                                                                            IN placeholder,
                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                            Iterable<? extends Channel<? extends IN,?>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified ones. If the list of data is smaller than the specified number of channels, the remaining ones will be fed with the specified placeholder instance. While, if the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channels A, B and C, their final output will be: 

        
 A => [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
 B => [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1), placeholder, ...]
 C => [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2), placeholder, placeholder, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<List<? extends IN>,?> distribute(@NotNull
                                                                            Iterable<? extends Channel<? extends IN,?>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified ones. If the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

 A => [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
 B => [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1)]
 C => [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2)]

      • flowInput

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelBuilder<IN,?> flowInput(@NotNull
                                                                             Channel<? super Flow<DATA>,?> channel,
                                                                             int id)
        Returns a builder of channels transforming the input data into flow ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel instances.

        Given channel A, its final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(id, IN), Flow(id, IN), Flow(id, IN), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the flow channel.
        id - the flow ID.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.

      • flowInput

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,IN,?> flowInput(@NotNull
                                                                                        Channel<? super Flow<DATA>,?> channel,
                                                                                        @NotNull
                                                                                        int... ids)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels accepting the data identified by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel map instances.

        Given channel A and channels IN1, IN2 and IN3 in the returned map, the final output of A will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(ids[1], IN2), Flow(ids[0], IN1), Flow(ids[2], IN3), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the flow channel.
        ids - the array of IDs.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • flowInput

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,IN,?> flowInput(@NotNull
                                                                                        Channel<? super Flow<DATA>,?> channel,
                                                                                        @NotNull
                                                                                        Iterable<Integer> ids)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels accepting the data identified by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel map instances.

        Given channel A and channels IN1, IN2 and IN3 in the returned map, the final output of A will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(ids[1], IN2), Flow(ids[0], IN1), Flow(ids[2], IN3), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the flow channel.
        ids - the iterable returning the flow IDs.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or returns a null object.

      • flowInput

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,IN,?> flowInput(int startId,
                                                                                        int rangeSize,
                                                                                        @NotNull
                                                                                        Channel<? super Flow<DATA>,?> channel)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels accepting the data identified by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several channel map instances.

        Given channel A and channels IN1, IN2 and IN3 in the returned map, the final output of A will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(startId + 1, IN2), Flow(startId + 0, IN1), Flow(startId + 2, IN3), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        startId - the flow start ID.
        rangeSize - the size of the range of IDs (must be positive).
        channel - the flow channel.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range size is not positive.

      • flowOutput

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,?,OUT> flowOutput(@NotNull
                                                                         Channel<?,? extends Flow<? extends OUT>> channel,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         int... ids)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels returning the output data filtered by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channels will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C in the returned map, the final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(ids[0], IN).data, Flow(ids[0], IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(ids[1], IN).data, Flow(ids[1], IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(ids[2], IN).data, Flow(ids[2], IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the flow channel.
        ids - the list of IDs.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • flowOutput

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,?,OUT> flowOutput(@NotNull
                                                                         Channel<?,? extends Flow<? extends OUT>> channel,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         Iterable<Integer> ids)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels returning the output data filtered by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channels will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C in the returned map, the final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(ids[0], IN).data, Flow(ids[0], IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(ids[1], IN).data, Flow(ids[1], IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(ids[2], IN).data, Flow(ids[2], IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the flow channel.
        ids - the iterable returning the flow IDs.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or returns a null object.

      • flowOutput

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelMapBuilder<Integer,?,OUT> flowOutput(int startId,
                                                                         int rangeSize,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         Channel<?,? extends Flow<? extends OUT>> channel)
        Returns a builder of maps of channels returning the output data filtered by the specified IDs.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channels will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C in the returned map, the final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, Flow(startId + 0, IN).data, ...]
 B => [Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, Flow(startId + 1, IN).data, ...]
 C => [Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, Flow(startId + 2, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        startId - the flow start ID.
        rangeSize - the size of the range of IDs (must be positive).
        channel - the flow channel.
        Returns:
        the map of IDs and channels builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range size is not positive.

      • fromFuture

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> fromFuture(@NotNull
                                                              Future<OUT> future)
        Returns a builder of channels producing the result of the specified Future.
        If the channel is aborted the Future will be cancelled with mayInterruptIfRunning set to false.

        Note that the configured runner will be employed to wait for the Future to complete.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        future - the Future instance.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.

      • fromFutureInterruptIfRunning

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> fromFutureInterruptIfRunning(@NotNull
                                                                                Future<OUT> future)
        Returns a builder of channels producing the result of the specified Future.
        If the channel is aborted the Future will be cancelled with mayInterruptIfRunning set to true.

        Note that the configured runner will be employed to wait for the Future to complete.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        future - the Future instance.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.

      • inputFlow

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelBuilder<Flow<IN>,?> inputFlow(@NotNull
                                                                 Channel<? super IN,?> channel,
                                                                 int id)
        Returns a builder of flow channels feeding the specified one.
        Each output will be filtered based on the specified ID.

        Note that the builder will return the same instance for the same input and equal configuration.

        Given channel A, its final output will be: 

        
 A => [Flow(id, IN).data, Flow(id, IN).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to feed.
        id - the flow ID.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,List<OUT>> join(@NotNull
                                                              Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), (A, B, C), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,List<OUT>> join(@NotNull
                                                              Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), (A, B, C), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,List<OUT>> join(@Nullable
                                                              OUT placeholder,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the channels are closed, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size as the channel list.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [(A, B, C), ..., (placeholder, B, C), ..., (placeholder, B, placeholder), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,List<OUT>> join(@Nullable
                                                              OUT placeholder,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the channels are closed, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size as the channel list.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [(A, B, C), ..., (placeholder, B, C), ..., (placeholder, B, placeholder), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the iterable of channels.
        Returns:
        the channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> merge(@NotNull
                                                               Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels merging the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the position in the array.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [Flow(1, B), Flow(0, A), Flow(2, C), Flow(0, A), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the channels to merge.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> merge(int startId,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               Channel<?,?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels merging the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will start from the specified one.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [Flow(startId + 1, B), Flow(startId + 0, A), Flow(startId + 2, C), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        startId - the flow start ID.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> merge(int startId,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels merging the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will start from the specified one.

        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        channels - the iterable of channels.

        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> merge(@NotNull
                                                               Iterable<? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels merging the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the position in the iterable.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [Flow(1, B), Flow(0, A), Flow(2, C), Flow(0, A), ...]
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> merge(@NotNull
                                                               Map<Integer,? extends Channel<?,? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels merging the specified instances into a flow one.
        The flow IDs will be the keys of the specified map.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed ones will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

        
 => [Flow(key(B), B), Flow(key(A), A), Flow(key(C), C), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the map of IDs and channels.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified map is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified map is null or contains a null object.

      • outputFlow

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,Flow<OUT>> outputFlow(@NotNull
                                                                    Channel<?,? extends OUT> channel,
                                                                    int id)
        Returns a builder of channels making the data of the specified one a flow.
        Each output will be passed along unchanged.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed one will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channel A, the final output will be: 

        
 => [Flow(id, A), Flow(id, A), Flow(id, A), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel.
        id - the flow ID.
        Returns:
        the flow channel builder.

      • replay

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelBuilder<?,OUT> replay(@NotNull
                                                          Channel<?,OUT> channel)
        Returns a builder of channels repeating the output data to any newly bound channel or consumer, thus effectively supporting multiple bindings.

        The Channel.isBound() method will always return false and the bind() methods will never fail.
        Note, however, that the implementation will silently prevent the same consumer or channel instance to be bound twice.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one channel instance, and that the passed one will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Note also that the returned channel will be already closed.

        Given channel A, the final output will be: 

        
 => [A, A, A, ...] => [A, A, A, ...] => [A, A, A, ...] ...
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel.
        Returns:
        the replaying channel builder.
